docTitle.titlePart:
A Competitive Inhibition Enzyme Immunoassay for Detection and
Quantification of Organophosphorus Compounds

byline.docAuthor: Peter Schmidt, Reiner Kühlmann, and Uli Lösch

byline.affiliation:
Institut für Physiologie, Physiologische Chemie und Ernährungsphysiologie,
Tierärztliche Fakultät, Universität München.

front.div:
A sensitive and specific method for detection and quantification of methyl phosphonic acid, p-
aminophenyl 1,2,2,-trimethyl-propyl diester (MATP) as a model substance for organophosphorus
compounds is described.
Different procedures for coupling the haptenic group for immunization, purification and im-
mobilization allowed the detection of hapten-specific antibodies.
The competitive inhibition enzyme immunoassay (CIEIA), using purified chicken and rabbit
IgG-antibodies, was able to detect MATP-concentrations as low as 1(T 10 mol/1.
Based upon our results, we postulate that the CIEIA represents a good alternative to the
customary diagnosis of organophosphate intoxications, measuring blood Cholinesterase activity.
